CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 16,17 Up to now , PCEs of the polymer solar cells incorporating BT / BO derivatives have reached 6-7 % , and hole mobilities of OFETs based on BT - containing polymers have been up to 1 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 after systematic optimization. 18,19 However , to the best of our knowledge , BT / BO - based polymers simultaneously with high field - effect mobilities and high photovoltaic performance are very rare so far. 6d,19b Thus , it still remains a big challenge to explore new BT / BO - based polymers to gain concurrently high field - effect mobility and high photovoltaic performance. On the basis of the above consideration , herein , we designed and synthesized two new D-A copolymers PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO ( Scheme 1 ) based on zNDT flanked with two thiophene units as donor unit and BT or BO as acceptor unit. We introduced two dodecyloxy substituents on BT / BO rings to guarantee good solubility of the polymers. The thermal , photophysical , and optoelectronic properties of the resulting two polymers were systematically investigated. The results showed that both the two polymers exhibit not only high fieldeffect mobilities but also high photovoltaic properties . Synthesis and Thermal Stability. The synthetic routes of monomers and corresponding polymers are outlined in Scheme 1. Monomer 1 was reacted with n-butyllithium and then with Me 3 SnCl to give compound M 1 in a good yield. Both polymers were synthesized by palladium - catalyzed Stille - coupling polymerization and purified by sequential Soxhlet extraction with methanol , hexanes , and CHCl 3 . The CHCl 3 fraction was then reduced in volume , precipitated into methanol , and collected by filtration , yielding shiny , bronze - colored solids. PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO can be readily dissolved in common solvents , such as chloroform , toluene , and chlorobenzene , and processed to form smooth and pinhole - free films upon spincoating. The molecular weights of the polymers were determined by GPC in THF solution relative to polystyrene standards , and the detailed GPC data are listed in Table 1.. Both polymers have good thermal stability with onset decomposition temperatures with 5% weight loss at 313-320 ° C . Obviously , the thermal stability of these polymers is adequate for their applications in PSCs , OFETs , and other optoelectronic devices. Optical Properties. , including the absorption peak wavelengths ( λ abs ) , the absorption edge wavelengths ( λ onset ) , and the optical band gap ( E g opt ). In Figure 3a , both of the absorption spectra recorded from dilute chloroform solutions display π-π* transitions at around 425 nm and large charge transfer features between 500 and 700 nm which are assigned by analogy to similar polymers , corresponding to intramolecular charge transfer ( ICT ) between the acceptor ( BT / BO ) and donor ( NDT ) units.

Let's think step by step.

1. The first material name entity is "PCEs of the polymer solar cells incorporating BT / BO derivatives." Here, BT/BO derivatives are the material.
2. The second material name entity is "BT - containing polymers" in "hole mobilities of OFETs based on BT - containing polymers."
3. The third material name entity is "BT / BO - based polymers" in "to the best of our knowledge , BT / BO - based polymers simultaneously with high field - effect mobilities and high photovoltaic performance are very rare so far."
4. The fourth material name entity is "zNDT flanked with two thiophene units as donor unit and BT or BO as acceptor unit" in "We designed and synthesized two new D-A copolymers PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO ( Scheme 1 ) based on zNDT flanked with two thiophene units as donor unit and BT or BO as acceptor unit."
5. The fifth material name entity is "BT or BO" in "zNDT flanked with two thiophene units as donor unit and BT or BO as acceptor unit."
6. The sixth material name entity is "dodecyloxy substituents" in "We introduced two dodecyloxy substituents on BT / BO rings to guarantee good solubility of the polymers."
7. The seventh material name entity is "monomers and corresponding polymers" in "The synthetic routes of monomers and corresponding polymers are outlined in Scheme 1."
8. The eighth material name entity is "compound M1" in "Monomer 1 was reacted with n-butyllithium and then with Me3 SnCl to give compound M1 in a good yield."
9. The ninth material name entity is "PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO" in "Both polymers were synthesized by palladium - catalyzed Stille - coupling polymerization and purified by sequential Soxhlet extraction with methanol , hexanes , and CHCl3."
10. The tenth material name entity is "methanol, hexanes, and CHCl3" in "Both polymers were synthesized by palladium - catalyzed Stille - coupling polymerization and purified by sequential Soxhlet extraction with methanol, hexanes, and CHCl3."
11. The eleventh material name entity is "CHCl3 fraction" in "The CHCl3 fraction was then reduced in volume, precipitated into methanol, and collected by filtration, yielding shiny, bronze-colored solids."
12. The twelfth material name entity is "chloroform, toluene, and chlorobenzene" in "PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO can be readily dissolved in common solvents, such as chloroform, toluene, and chlorobenzene, and processed to form smooth and pinhole-free films upon spincoating."
13. The thirteenth material name entity is "polystyrene standards" in "The molecular weights of the polymers were determined by GPC in THF solution relative to polystyrene standards, and the detailed GPC data are listed in Table 1."
14. The fourteenth material name entity is "THF solution" in "The molecular weights of the polymers were determined by GPC in THF solution relative to polystyrene standards, and the detailed GPC data are listed in Table 1."
15. The fifteenth material name entity is "BT / BO rings" in "We introduced two dodecyloxy substituents on BT / BO rings to guarantee good solubility of the polymers."
16. The sixteenth material name entity is "π-π*" in "In Figure 3a, both of the absorption spectra recorded from dilute chloroform solutions display π-π* transitions at around 425 nm and large charge transfer features between 500 and 700 nm which are assigned by analogy to similar polymers, corresponding to intramolecular charge transfer (ICT) between the acceptor (BT / BO) and donor (NDT) units."
17. The seventeenth material name entity is "NDT" in "In Figure 3a, both of the absorption spectra recorded from dilute chloroform solutions display π-π* transitions at around 425 nm and large charge transfer features between 500 and 700 nm which are assigned by analogy to similar polymers, corresponding to intramolecular charge transfer (ICT) between the acceptor (BT / BO) and donor (NDT) units."

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 16,17 Up to now , PCEs of the polymer solar cells incorporating BT / BO derivatives have reached 6-7 % , and hole mobilities of OFETs based on BT - containing polymers have been up to 1 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 after systematic optimization. 18,19 However , to the best of our knowledge , BT / BO - based polymers simultaneously with high field - effect mobilities and high photovoltaic performance are very rare so far. 6d,19b Thus , it still remains a big challenge to explore new BT / BO - based polymers to gain concurrently high field - effect mobility and high photovoltaic performance. On the basis of the above consideration , herein , we designed and synthesized two new D-A copolymers PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO ( Scheme 1 ) based on zNDT flanked with two thiophene units as donor unit and BT or BO as acceptor unit. We introduced two dodecyloxy substituents on BT / BO rings to guarantee good solubility of the polymers. The thermal , photophysical , and optoelectronic properties of the resulting two polymers were systematically investigated. The results showed that both the two polymers exhibit not only high fieldeffect mobilities but also high photovoltaic properties . Synthesis and Thermal Stability. The synthetic routes of monomers and corresponding polymers are outlined in Scheme 1. Monomer 1 was reacted with n-butyllithium and then with Me 3 SnCl to give compound M 1 in a good yield. Both polymers were synthesized by palladium - catalyzed Stille - coupling polymerization and purified by sequential Soxhlet extraction with methanol , hexanes , and CHCl 3 . The CHCl 3 fraction was then reduced in volume , precipitated into methanol , and collected by filtration , yielding shiny , bronze - colored solids. PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO can be readily dissolved in common solvents , such as chloroform , toluene , and chlorobenzene , and processed to form smooth and pinhole - free films upon spincoating. The molecular weights of the polymers were determined by GPC in THF solution relative to polystyrene standards , and the detailed GPC data are listed in Table 1.. Both polymers have good thermal stability with onset decomposition temperatures with 5% weight loss at 313-320 ° C . Obviously , the thermal stability of these polymers is adequate for their applications in PSCs , OFETs , and other optoelectronic devices. Optical Properties. , including the absorption peak wavelengths ( λ abs ) , the absorption edge wavelengths ( λ onset ) , and the optical band gap ( E g opt ). In Figure 3a , both of the absorption spectra recorded from dilute chloroform solutions display π-π* transitions at around 425 nm and large charge transfer features between 500 and 700 nm which are assigned by analogy to similar polymers , corresponding to intramolecular charge transfer ( ICT ) between the acceptor ( BT / BO ) and donor ( NDT ) units.

Let's think step by step.

1. BT or BO derivatives: These are the acceptor units in the polymer solar cells. They are used in conjunction with the donor unit to create the polymer-based solar cells.
2. Hole mobilities: This is a property of organic field-effect transistors (OFETs) that describes how easily holes (positive charges) can move through the material.
3. High field-effect mobilities: This is a desirable property for organic field-effect transistors, as it allows for efficient charge transport.
4. High photovoltaic performance: This is a desirable property for polymer solar cells, as it indicates that the cells are able to effectively convert light into electrical energy.
5. zNDT: This is a donor unit used in the two new D-A copolymers synthesized in the study. It is flanked with two thiophene units.
6. Thermal stability: This is a property of the polymers that describes their ability to withstand high temperatures without degrading.
7. Optical properties: This includes the absorption peak wavelengths (λabs), the absorption edge wavelengths (λonset), and the optical band gap (Eg opt). These properties describe how the polymers interact with light.
8. π-π* transitions: This is a type of electronic transition that occurs in the polymers when they absorb light.
9. Intramolecular charge transfer (ICT): This is a process in which charge is transferred within a single molecule, in this case between the acceptor (BT/BO) and donor (NDT) units.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

1. Hole mobilities
2. High field-effect mobilities
3. High photovoltaic performance
4. Thermal stability
5. Optical properties
6. Absorption peak wavelengths (λabs)
7. Absorption edge wavelengths (λonset)
8. Optical band gap (Eg opt)
9. π-π* transitions
10. Intramolecular charge transfer (ICT)

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 16,17 Up to now , PCEs of the polymer solar cells incorporating BT / BO derivatives have reached 6-7 % , and hole mobilities of OFETs based on BT - containing polymers have been up to 1 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 after systematic optimization. 18,19 However , to the best of our knowledge , BT / BO - based polymers simultaneously with high field - effect mobilities and high photovoltaic performance are very rare so far. 6d,19b Thus , it still remains a big challenge to explore new BT / BO - based polymers to gain concurrently high field - effect mobility and high photovoltaic performance. On the basis of the above consideration , herein , we designed and synthesized two new D-A copolymers PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO ( Scheme 1 ) based on zNDT flanked with two thiophene units as donor unit and BT or BO as acceptor unit. We introduced two dodecyloxy substituents on BT / BO rings to guarantee good solubility of the polymers. The thermal , photophysical , and optoelectronic properties of the resulting two polymers were systematically investigated. The results showed that both the two polymers exhibit not only high fieldeffect mobilities but also high photovoltaic properties . Synthesis and Thermal Stability. The synthetic routes of monomers and corresponding polymers are outlined in Scheme 1. Monomer 1 was reacted with n-butyllithium and then with Me 3 SnCl to give compound M 1 in a good yield. Both polymers were synthesized by palladium - catalyzed Stille - coupling polymerization and purified by sequential Soxhlet extraction with methanol , hexanes , and CHCl 3 . The CHCl 3 fraction was then reduced in volume , precipitated into methanol , and collected by filtration , yielding shiny , bronze - colored solids. PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO can be readily dissolved in common solvents , such as chloroform , toluene , and chlorobenzene , and processed to form smooth and pinhole - free films upon spincoating. The molecular weights of the polymers were determined by GPC in THF solution relative to polystyrene standards , and the detailed GPC data are listed in Table 1.. Both polymers have good thermal stability with onset decomposition temperatures with 5% weight loss at 313-320 ° C . Obviously , the thermal stability of these polymers is adequate for their applications in PSCs , OFETs , and other optoelectronic devices. Optical Properties. , including the absorption peak wavelengths ( λ abs ) , the absorption edge wavelengths ( λ onset ) , and the optical band gap ( E g opt ). In Figure 3a , both of the absorption spectra recorded from dilute chloroform solutions display π-π* transitions at around 425 nm and large charge transfer features between 500 and 700 nm which are assigned by analogy to similar polymers , corresponding to intramolecular charge transfer ( ICT ) between the acceptor ( BT / BO ) and donor ( NDT ) units.

Let's think step by step.

1. Hole mobilities of OFETs based on BT-containing polymers have been up to 1 cm^2 V-1 s^-1.
2. The two polymers, PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO, exhibit high field-effect mobilities.
3. Both polymers have good thermal stability with onset decomposition temperatures with 5% weight loss at 313-320 ° C.
4. The absorption peak wavelengths (λabs) of the two polymers are around 425 nm.
5. The absorption edge wavelengths (λonset) of the two polymers are beyond 700 nm.
6. The optical band gap (Eg opt) of the two polymers is not explicitly stated, but it can be calculated from the λonset values using the formula Eg opt = 1240/λonset.

Note: The values are extracted from the text and converted to the required format. The optical band gap is calculated based on the provided information.

4. The absorption peak wavelengths (λabs) of the two polymers are around 425 nm.
